overview_of_class:
This course stages a conversation among blackness, Latinidad and sexuality by examining the work of
black and brown artists in the black diaspora. Using "blacktino" as the framing device, the course will
highlight how these artists index the specificities of black and brown social and political relations, while
also waging a broader queer-of-color critique of institutionalized racism and homophobia. Students will
engage these artists' work on various levels, including textual analysis, embodied experience, critical
reception, and site specific engagement.*

*The class includes a mandatory experiential learning trip to New York City (May 26-29, 2017). Travel expenses will
be subsidized for all enrolled students.
